1.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

1.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

1.str2: A household manager, a steward, guardian.

1.str2: From dia and skorpizo; to dissipate, i.e. to rout or separate; specially, to winnow; figuratively, to squander.

1.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
1.str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

2.str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.

30.str2: From meta and noieo; to think differently or afterwards, i.e. Reconsider.

31.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

31.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
31.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

31.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
31.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

31.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
31.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

31.word: they will not be persuaded even
31.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
31.str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

31.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
31.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

31.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
31.str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
